intro: Gabila longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved gabila, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Gabila longifolia typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
